intro: Payena selangorica, commonly known as the Selangor payena, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
